etymologies: Old English welig, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wilg

definitions: a tree or shrub of temperate climates that typically has narrow leaves, bears catkins, and grows near water. Its pliant branches yield osiers for basketry, and its wood has various uses.

notes.text: Genus Salix, family Salicaceae: many species

shortDefinitions: tree or shrub of temperate climates that has narrow leaves

definitions: a machine with revolving spikes used for cleaning cotton, wool, or other fibers.
shortDefinitions: machine with revolving spikes used for cleaning fibers
